intro: Ayenia cardiopetala, commonly known as the heart-leaved ayenia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features palmately divided leaves that are often heart-shaped, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Ayenia cardiopetala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
